title: Applied Econometrics
text:
I use state-of-the-art econometric techniques in three main topics:
The effects of Air Pollution on the Individual

What are the effects of air pollution on productivity?
what are the effects of air pollution on criminality and Domestic Violence?
What are the effects of air pollution on Decision Making?
How do the indirect effects of air pollution on children affect the well-being of their parents?

Air Pollution Control Mechanisms at the City Level

How efficient are current policies in reducing the use of internal combustion engines?
What are the effects of air quality alerts on parents’ avoidance behaviour?

Digitalization, Transport, and Pollution

What is the effect of Ride-Hailing Technologies on Urban Air Pollution?







Note



In the future, I would like to study the effects of climate change on health, labor productivity, and human behavior.

title: Energy Modeling
text:
Introduction
I employ techno-economic bottom-up energy models to examine transition pathways of the North-American energy system.
My research answers questions like:

What are the effects of variations in natural gas prices on the future of the North American energy system?
What is the role of storage technologies in the uptake of renewable energy?
What is the future of the Mexican energy system?
What are the consequences of changing the dispatch system from merit to physical order dispatch?
What are the distributional consequences of high-electrification scenarios in North America?

Besides techno-economic models of the energy system, I am currently developing an Agent-Based Model of technology adoption with my colleagues at the European Institute on Economics and the Environment. The ABM-REN model aims to understand households’ decisions to adopt green technologies.
I also contribute to the 37th Energy Modelling Forum on high electrification scenarios in North America.
